### When AI Agents Go Rogue: Agent Session Smuggling Attack in A2A Systems


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses the emerging cybersecurity threat known as "Agent Session Smuggling Attack" in Agent-to-Agent (A2A) systems, which are utilized by AI agents to communicate and collaborate autonomously. This type of attack occurs when malicious actors exploit vulnerabilities within the session management protocols of A2A systems, allowing them to inject or hijack AI agent sessions for unauthorized access or control. The piece highlights the potential consequences of such attacks, including data breaches and unauthorized system manipulations, emphasizing the need for

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/agent-session-smuggling-in-agent2agent-systems/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9064)**

### Engineering.ai: A Platform for Teams of AI Engineers in Computational Design


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


Engineering.ai is a platform specifically designed to streamline the collaborative efforts of AI engineers working in the field of computational design. It addresses the growing need for specialized tools that facilitate the development, testing, and deployment of artificial intelligence applications within this niche. By offering an integrated environment, Engineering.ai enhances team productivity and innovation by simplifying complex workflows and improving communication among team members. The platform includes features that support project management, version control, and real-time collaboration, making it an invaluable asset for engineering teams aiming to leverage

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://arxiv.org/abs/2511.00122?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5045)**

### Kimsuky Debuts HTTPTroy Backdoor Against South Korea Users


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses a new cybersecurity threat posed by the North Korean hacking group Kimsuky, which has introduced a backdoor malware named HTTPTroy targeting South Korean users. This malicious software is designed to evade detection by security systems and facilitate unauthorized access to compromised devices. The HTTPTroy backdoor is employed primarily for espionage purposes, focusing on extracting sensitive information from targeted individuals and organizations. Cybersecurity experts emphasize the sophistication of this malware, underscoring the persistent and evolving nature of cyber

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.darkreading.com/vulnerabilities-threats/kimsuky-httptroy-backdoor-south-korea-users?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_8317)**

### Aisuru Botnet Shifts from DDoS to Residential Proxies


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The Aisuru botnet, initially known for executing Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks, has evolved its operations to focus on creating residential proxies. By leveraging compromised devices, Aisuru is now renting out these devices as proxy nodes, effectively obscuring and rerouting internet traffic through residential IP addresses. This shift enhances its ability to bypass conventional security measures and execute illicit online activities, such as credential stuffing and ad fraud, with greater stealth and effectiveness. Security experts are concerned about

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/10/aisuru-botnet-shifts-from-ddos-to-residential-proxies/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1000)**


---


### SesameOp: Novel backdoor uses OpenAI Assistants API for command and control


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses a new cybersecurity threat called "SesameOp," which leverages OpenAI's Assistants API as a novel method for command and control in cyberattacks. Attackers are exploiting the API to execute malicious instructions and coordinate compromised systems under the guise of legitimate queries to AI-powered assistants. This strategy provides the attackers with a stealthy and scalable avenue to obfuscate their activities, posing significant challenges for traditional security defenses. The report emphasizes the need for heightened vigilance and advanced security measures to

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2025/11/03/sesameop-novel-backdoor-uses-openai-assistants-api-for-command-and-control/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_4657)**

### The 5 generative AI security threats you need to know about detailed in new e-book


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


The new e-book titled "The 5 Generative AI Security Threats You Need to Know About" explores the potential security risks associated with the rise of generative AI technologies. It highlights five major threats: the creation of sophisticated and convincing deepfakes, the automatization of phishing and social engineering attacks, the enhancement of malware through AI-driven evolution, the exploitation of AI-generated content for misinformation campaigns, and vulnerabilities within AI models themselves that could be leveraged by malicious actors. The e-book aims to

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2025/10/30/the-5-generative-ai-security-threats-you-need-to-know-about-detailed-in-new-e-book/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1054)**

### EPIC Convenes Webinar on Salt Typhoon and Its Implications for Encryption and Communications Security


üõ°Ô∏è **SECURITY ALERT**


The Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) recently hosted a webinar titled "Salt Typhoon and Its Implications for Encryption and Communications Security," which focused on the emerging challenges and potential threats posed by the Salt Typhoon vulnerability to current encryption technologies and communication systems. The event brought together experts from the fields of cybersecurity, encryption, and privacy to discuss the mechanisms of Salt Typhoon, its impact on existing digital infrastructure, and strategies to mitigate associated risks.
